comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: NYT article from April 21, 1921, JACK CUDAHY KILLS HIMSELF BY SHOT FROM HUNTING GUN query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9505EEDC1739E133A... summarizes Jack Cudahy's marital affairs. In 1899, he was married to Edna Corwin. In 1910, Cudahy came home to find a banker "in company with" his wife. He attacked the man and Mrs. Cudahy called the police. Shortly after they separated and then divorced. In 1912 they reconciled and remarried. They were still together when he committed suicide. So this will presumably be the former Edna Corwin. The story is definitely material for a soap opera!! And the hat is spectacular.

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: Edna Margaret Cowin Cudahy (Oct. 31, 1877, in Nebraska, USA - Sep. 10, 1949 in Los Angeles County, California, USA) (www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=108688328) This photo (or very similar, but reversed) is in The Salt Lake herald-Republican., March 14, 1910, Image 1, with an article concerning the attack on the banker.
